engine

Interface EditionEngine

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ImplementedEngine

    public interface EditionEngine
    An edition engine allows for a variety of actions to edit a text. These actions are: Copy, Cut, Paste, Select, Delete text, Insert text. An edition engine is composed of : - A buffer, allowing modification and storage of a text. - A clipboard, allowing the copy/cut/paste actions. - a selection, allowing the edition of parts of the text in the buffer
    See Also:
    Buffer, Clipboard, Selection

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void copy()
      Copy of the selection to the clipboard.
      void cut()
      Cut the selection to the clipboard.
      void deleteText()
      Delete the selection from the buffer.
      void insertText(String s)
      Insert the given string in the buffer.
      void paste()
      Paste the clipboard to the buffer.
      void redo()
      Redo the last command on the stack.
      void select(Selection s)
      Set the selection to the given selection.
      void undo()
      Undo the last command on the stack.
